meanings.definition: To cultivate (microorganisms or cells) in a new or different culture medium.
meanings.sent1: The scientist subcultured the bacteria in a nutrient-rich solution.
meanings.sent2: She subcultured the cells in a petri dish to observe their growth.
meanings.sent3: After the experiment, the bacteria subcultured happily in their cozy environment.
meanings.sent4: The new generation of cells subcultured in the lab, adapting to their surroundings.
meanings.sent5: The microbiologist carefully subcultured the organisms, ensuring their survival.

meanings.definition: To introduce (microorganisms or cells) into a culture medium.
meanings.sent1: The researcher subcultured the yeast into the agar plate for testing.
meanings.sent2: They subcultured the bacteria into the flask to study their behavior.
meanings.sent3: The microorganisms were excited to be subcultured into their new home.
meanings.sent4: The cells were subcultured into the medium, ready to thrive in their new environment.
meanings.sent5: The lab technician subcultured the samples, preparing them for analysis.
